reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Sharm and the Ghazala Beach hotel for the first time at the beginning of June and enjoyed our stay very much. As reviews have stated it is very close to Na'ama Bay which is a short walk away. We were given a bungalow near to the pool which was clean and tidy with everything that we needed. The only slight problem was that on a couple of nights there were beach partys etc with very loud music which could be heard until quite late this did not bother us too much but mentioned it so others who may be disturbed by it can ask for a room in the main hotel. The staff are all very friendly and Ahmeen our cleaner kept our room spotless also Bianca the guest relations manager is very helpful and nothing is too much trouble for her. We ate at all the restaurants connected to the hotel and the food was really nice in all of them. Make sure you pay a visit to the spa as they are very good I had a manicure, pedicure and facial but remember to haggle the price! Had a great holiday and would definitely return to this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Yesterday we returned from Sharm ell sheikh. Hotel is old and so the equiplment in the hotel but the location and very good and kind stuff, old but very clean room, good food and hot sea is all what we need. We enjoy very much. We strongly recomend the snorkling on Tiran island where the corals are amazing. The Sharm is much better than Hurghada if you prefer to walk around, have a dring, a little shopping... For shoping I recomend shsrm el sheikh old market. Absolutely we will go to Sharm back!
reviews.title: Excelent location and stuff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to sharm many times but always stayed at the Crowne Plaza. Over the last couple of visits it went downhill so we decided to try somewhere else. The Ghazala beach looked ok so we thought we would give it a shot. Great choice. Hotel very clean, great location, private beach. very friendly & helpful staff. Good choice of eating out at 6 restaurants.While there it was Heathers birthday. She had a cake sent to our room with a letter wishing her a happy birthday & 25% off a meal in one of the restaurants. Our rep Sayeed was really friendly & helpful as was Jane from guest relations. On our 2nd week we went to Petra for the day but when we got back we had no power in our room. We were moved next door but air con was no good We mentioned it to our new rep Islam who mentioned it to reception. We were upgraded to a junior suite for the rest of our stay. How cool is that. All in all we think the hotel & all the staff were excellent
reviews.title: A brilliant place to stay

reviews.text: fantastic location, has its own beach right on red sea, two pools, rooms lovely, staff very friendly and helpful. everything is so clean, huge choice of food for breakfast, lunch and dinner and right off the main street - really couldn't fault this place would certainly go here again.
reviews.title: couldn't fault hotel, staff or food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: but trips very expensive with red sea holidays, there is many other excursion providers on main street - we went with Sharmboys (just at the end of the main street) they were brilliant and about £50 cheaper than anywhere else
reviews.title: An amazing holiday

reviews.text: Just returned from a two week diving trip, staying at this hotel but diving elsewhere. The hotel is located perfectly for all the delights of Naama Bay, but far enough away to ensure a quiet stay. The garden rooms are adequate, but in need of an upgrade, and our cleaner was excellent. The garden room 'patios' are pretty basic, and for some non existent. the patio chairs for all except those near the pool are also pretty dire. The Gardens and Pool areas are very clean and well kept. The staff are mostly very helpful, and generally respond to requests promptly, however Bianca, of Red Sea Holidays, is the 'make it so' person - she is very good. All the restaurants we visited that are attached to the Hotel provide good food at good value, however the main restaurant could do with some changes, e.g. controlling the sparrows!
reviews.title: With some long overdue remedial work this hotel could be great

reviews.text: The beach area is large and generally well presented, but the beach staff were sometimes hard to find, and the beach 'supervisor' was difficult to deal with at times. The entertainment leaves a lot to be desired, sometimes spoiling the atmosphere in the Beach Bar by being too loud. This is compensated somewhat by the friendliness of the Beach Bar Staff.
reviews.title: Rooms and main restaurant in need of a make over.
Time to renovate
reviews.text: We are returning to this hotel in October, so it must be ok!

Just spent two weeks here on a diving holiday. Great venue close to al amenities and has its own beach. Lovely, spacious grounds and all the restaurants with exception of the main one, where we had breakfast, are very good and consistently so. Staff are hardworking and professional especially reception bar staff , cleaners, restaurant staff particularly so the De Franco. Bianca the customer services manager is helpful, friendly and sorts out any problems quickly. Downside is that the lovely garden rooms are in need of a serious upgrade as is the main restaurant which needs to review its layout and stop birds feeding on the food that is not covered up! Staff on here can be really helpful or disinterested very inconsistent. It is these two factors that let this hotel down. Likewise, it's posher sister across the road Ghazala Gardens, we had an excellent meal in O Fogo and the hotel is impressive inside but the females toilets were a disgrace the night we visited. Much potential bit needs some investment in Ghazala Beach hotel and a consistency of high standards.
reviews.title: great holiday will be returning agian

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 5th visit to Ghazala Beach, and it's time they renovate at least the bungalows. No hot water for days, AC not working, re-locating to another bungalow and again no hot water.
reviews.title: Hotel in Naama

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, its great to be able to walk outside of the hotel and along to Naama bay. The private beach is great and the coral is brilliant for snorkelling or diving. Having the Sinai Diving school on site is also brilliant.
reviews.title: Great location, but other aspects were disappointing

reviews.text: The food for breakfast was great and the Italian restaurant on site was also excellent - however I did not enjoy the asian food restaurant at all (you'd think being beside the sea the sushi would be fresh, but it was terrible) and the ghazala beach bar was not great either (although their cocktails were excellent). The restaurants on site are expensive, as you would expect - its worth going out for dinner if possible, and if you can bare to stand the constant hassle from the providers.
reviews.title: I recommend this hotel 100%.

reviews.text: On the beach you are frequently bothered by reps from the salon (often making rude comments about your appearance in order to shame you into having a treatment) or by the water sports group (which is very expensive). I would not recommend the Grand Spa at all - the staff were abrasive, rude and out to scam you. However, the experience with the spa situated on the beach was much more pleasant and highly recommended.
reviews.title: Derek395

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was also very disappointed with the gym - something that is very important to me when I am away. It only opens between 9am and 9pm and they charge you 5 euros per day. The gym is not staffed and the equipment is not overwhelming either.
reviews.title: First visit to Ghazala

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quiet and the bed very comfortable. There was ample space and plenty of english t.v to watch when i was struggling with sickness. The hotel was very clean and the bed was made every day.
reviews.title: Roy

reviews.text: Ghazala Beach offers all you need, especially if you are looking for value. Apart from the extensive buffet available to all guests the hotel has a variety of restaurants Italian Chinese Mexican Lebanese etc. which offer increasing discounts the more you dine. Children are catered for. The beach is safe and there are lifeguards who monitor the beach who help out with the loungers and there are plenty of these. The hotel representatives are available everyday for any problems. The travel company rep was also available. There was no hard sell of all the hotel had to offer spa massage, trips etc . I have been to Egypt 8 times before but this is the first time I have stayed here and am planning to return next year.
reviews.title: If you want a lazy holiday with sun sea sand on your doorstep for good value this is the place to stay with the added bonus of

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With this being my second trip to sharm el sheikh, Ghazala Beach really made it an enjoyable one. Even though the hotel is a little outdated, the service we recieved was impeccable at times. All the staff are really friendly and couldn't be more happier to help, specially Islam (Redsea Holidays rep). The hotel was clean and provided great amenities and is fantastically located. The staff at the private beach (Hysham) was extremely attentive and made our holiday a enjoyable and relaxing experience. I agree with what others have to say about the sunbeds on the beach which requires more attention but no harm done. Secondly with regards to location, it is approx 5 mins walk to the hustle bustle promenade. This place is crazy, you need to ensure you are prepared for this. However the most polite way to say you are not interested is to use the word (SHUK-RAN) which means thank you in Arabic. We did Quad biking for 3 hours are paid a tenner, speed boating which was booked whilst we were on the beach and paid £45 each which entails snorkelling on 2 different islands and finally ended our holiday with a visit to the Soho Square (Ice Bar) This is a must do which was booked with Red Sea Holidays from the hotel itself which entails a free entry to the ice bar, a game of bowling and Culturama (Egyptian History)
reviews.title: Celebrated Anniversary & 30th Birthday 2in1

reviews.text: We will definitely be using Ghazala beach again !!!!
reviews.title: You get you pay for!! :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my partner arrived back from ghazala beach hotel last night. The hotel is exactly what it states to be (booked through red sea holidays.) Its clean but basic. Could do with some updates but I can't complain when only paying £25O pp for bed and breakfast and flights. There a two pools both of good sizes and we always found a sunbed even later on in the day, we found more people on the beach, the beach is lovely and sandy unlike other beaches you may find in sharm. The food in the ghazala beach bar is average, the hotel kebab hut is good for a quick tea, I ate 3 times during our 3 night stay at kokai - getting take out twice as I really didn't enjoy walking around naama bay as there is way to much hassle. If you ignore the egyptian people they basically insult you or grab your hand and try to drag you along. Also the men on camels will walk there camel into you if you don't take a picture which will cost you. Really cannot moan about the hotel at all, only problem is on the 1st floor there are cupboards which we often found open - when looking in the cupboard we found a 2Oft drop and pipes/drains - I'd say dangerous for children or if you've had a one to many. Staff are friendly, but can be a bit to cheeky demanding tips. I gave the porter 3 english pounds as I hadn't changed my money - I got a frown!!! And I heard 'can I keep the change' way to often!!! I certainly recommend the hotel massage!! Don't be fooled by the prices we got 6 hours worth of massage through the week for £15O when it should of been triple!! If you can handle feeling imtimidated all week, followed about, constantly being beeped at and the awful looking dumpsites around you then this is a bargain for you :) :) I recommend spider cafe! Turn left coming out of the back of the hotel and walk for about 15 minutes! We went every day as they was the friendliest egyptians we met! Cheap shisha pipes and will help you with anything! Freshly squeezed fruit juices! Any u can imagine!!!
reviews.title: Escape from chilly UK

reviews.text: Back again for a much needed break and most importantly some sunshine!!! Lovely to see Bianca and Jane again (our holiday reps).Feels like "coming home" . Staff friendly, pool side room clean and adequate. Lovely weather and fantastic sea, fish etc... Nice to see some familiar faces again, Jean and Conn. Pool clean and gardens fairly well kept. The beach needs slight attention and some of the beach sunbeds could do with replacing.
reviews.title: Family holiday in Ghazala Beach
